intro: Thalictrum majus var. globiflorum, commonly known as the globeflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped inflorescences composed of numerous small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate and ethereal beauty to the landscape.
